hero.title: Driving The Future Mobility
hero.subtitle: Innovating the future of mobility — one solution at a time.

about.heroSubtitle: Learn more about our mission, values, and journey in shaping the future of mobility.
about.missionIntro: A KAIST based startup, a key innovator in developing virtual environments for the mobility industry, was established in December 2024. Our expertise lies in creating precise, high-fidelity virtual simulations that maximize the safety and efficiency of autonomous systems.
about.missionText: A KAIST based startup, a key innovator in developing virtual environments for the mobility industry, was established in December 2024. Our expertise lies in creating precise, high-fidelity virtual simulations that maximize the safety and efficiency of autonomous systems. Our core technology allows us to accurately replicate complex real-world scenarios, including roads, traffic conditions, and various environmental variables. This capability helps overcome the significant time and cost constraints typically associated with physical testing. As a result, we can quickly and safely validate and improve the performance of next-generation mobility systems, such as autonomous vehicles, drones, and UAM solutions. Developed by KAIST researchers, our proprietary technology is accelerating the progress of future mobility solutions.
about.solutionsText: Explore our innovative solutions designed to transform urban mobility through cutting-edge simulation and digital twin.
about.projectsText: Discover our impactful projects shaping the future of smart cities with advanced AI and simulation technologies.
about.teamText: Meet the talented researchers, engineers, and experts driving mobility innovation with decades of combined experience.

technologies.heroSubtitle: Discover the innovative technologies powering the future of mobility.

visum.title: Mesoscopic Model​
visum.subtitle: A mesoscopic traffic demand prediction and operation evaluation model

howItWorks: Uses SBA (Simulation Based Assignment) with dynamic traffic assignment.
Considers time-varying traffic volume and road capacity for precise forecasting.
Connects with Vissim micro-simulation for detailed scenario evaluations.
whatItCanDo: Predicts traffic demand and congestion for large developments and major events (e.g., Olympics, Expos).
Supports optimal traffic signal plans under different development conditions.
Enables efficient, scalable traffic operation analysis for new projects.
whereItCanBeUsed: Traffic operation centers and government agencies.
Consulting projects in Korea, Saudi Arabia, UAE, Southeast Asia.

vissim.title: Microscopic Model​
vissim.subtitle: A detailed micro-simulation tool for replicating vehicle interactions

howItWorks: Connects with Visum meso-model outputs for micro-level traffic operation analysis.
Uses vehicle trajectory data for scenario evaluations.
Supports high-resolution simulation and validation of traffic control strategies.
whatItCanDo: Analyze intersection performance and optimize traffic signals.
Evaluate traffic impacts from new transport policies and infrastructure.
Generate life-saving robot simulations and driving simulator inputs for immersive scenario testing.
whereItCanBeUsed: Traffic impact assessments for new developments.
Life-saving robot visualizations for public agencies and emergency response strategy.

mesh.title: 3D Mesh Model and Visualisation
mesh.subtitle: High-quality 3D mesh models of roads and urban infrastructure for advanced visualization.

howItWorks: Uses LX data, OSM, LiDAR, and photogrammetry for 3D mesh creation.
Integrates with macro and micro simulation data in Unity for seamless visual outputs.
Allows manual mesh refinement for accurate elevation and asset placement.
whatItCanDo: Create high-quality visual materials for transport policy and project communication.
Support driving simulators and life-saving robot environments for safety and operational evaluation.
Enable clear scenario comparison and visualization for non-expert stakeholders.
whereItCanBeUsed: Life-saving robot-based public engagement and training.
Projects in Saudi, UAE, and Southeast Asia markets.

digitalTwin.title: Digital Twin Model
digitalTwin.subtitle: A real-time digital replica of traffic networks integrated with 3D visual environments.

howItWorks: Combines macro, meso, micro-simulations, and 3D models.
Updates dynamically with scenario changes and planned infrastructure.
Connects to ITS systems for real-time traffic visualization and scenario playback.
whatItCanDo: Visualize future traffic impacts of developments and events.
Optimize signal timing and traffic management strategies.
Enhance stakeholder understanding through immersive scenario demonstrations.
whereItCanBeUsed: Government policy testing and scenario analysis.
Public communication and life-saving robot scenario demonstrations.

hero.title: Multimodal Simulator

overview.MO-1Desc: Comprehensive multimodal testing environment that models and simulates complex interactions between e-scooters and autonomous vehicles in urban traffic scenarios to enhance transportation safety.
overview.MO-2Desc: An infrastructure with many sensors ensures safe driving for autonomous vehicles by orchestrating them when they are in blind spots. Virtual agents are injected to influence real vehicles, enabling them to learn and drive safely in complex urban environments.

hero.title: Traffic Impact Analysis
hero.subtitle: Comprehensive traffic analysis platform with one-click automation and multi-scale simulation capabilities for policy evaluation and traffic optimization--- A new distruptive development coming soon!!!---

overview.title: Overview
overview.demoDesc: A large scale network analysis for comprehensive traffic evaluation. This is particularly how the shared bike system is operated in Daejeon
overview.TA-1Desc: Co-simulation between VISSIM and Unity is a powerful technique for creating highly realistic and interactive virtual environments for traffic and transportation research. It combines the strengths of both platforms: VISSIM for its robust, validated, and detailed microscopic traffic simulation, and Unity for its advanced 3D rendering, physics, and a wide range of life-saving robot simulation and human-in-the-loop capabilities
overview.TA-2Desc: A specialized and powerful form of Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) simulation. It combines a real, physical piece of hardware—the dynamometer—with one or more virtual simulation models. This approach is widely used in the automotive and aerospace industries for testing and developing powertrains and control systems
overview.TA-3: Micro simulation - EV autonomous charging station
overview.TA-3Desc: An autonomous EV charging station is a system that can charge an electric vehicle without any human intervention. Using microsimulation, this technology is being developed to address some of the key challenges of the growing EV market
overview.TA-4: Activity Based Model for Hwaseung City in Korea
overview.TA-4Desc: This model focuses on understanding and simulating the autonomous vehicle level 4+ that will occur within Hwaseung City in 2027, providing insights into traffic patterns and urban mobility.

technical.title: Technical Details
technical.spec3: Micro: Signal optimization and emergency response integration
technical.academicInfo: Bo Wang et al. short-term traffic prediction research (Nov 2023)

overview.LSR-1Desc: The robot can navigate complex environments, identify hazards, and support evacuation efforts. Whether by directing crowd flow, delivering essential supplies, or providing situational awareness to first responders, this robot plays a crucial role in reducing risk and saving lives during critical moments.

projects.heroSubtitle: Explore our portfolio of innovative mobility and smart city projects.

naepo.title: Naepo New City Digital Twin
naepo.explanation: Dochak will position itself as a regional mobility innovation leader in Chungnam by using digital twins and simulation for traffic solutions.
naepo.detailedDescription: Developing Korea's first traffic-focused digital twin for Naepo New City to support advanced mobility planning and operations. The system integrates real-time data collection, AI-based predictive modeling, and 3D visualization to help city planners and operators make better decisions. This project plays a key role in sustainable urban development and building a smart mobility ecosystem.
naepo.impact: This project is expected to improve traffic efficiency by 30%, reduce carbon emissions by 25%, and reduce citizens' travel time by an average of 20%. It will also contribute to local economic revitalization and job creation.

impactStats.text: Improvement of driving speed for overlapping routes (114 and 115)
Reduction of average travel time after the introduction of articulated buses

naepo.videoTitle: Naepo New City Digital Twin Demo
naepo.videoDescription: Demonstration video of real-time traffic monitoring and prediction system using digital twin technology.

teleDriving.title: Daejeon-Jeju Tele-driving
teleDriving.explanation: Provides remote driver intervention when autonomous vehicles encounter issues, addressing limitations of autonomous systems.
teleDriving.detailedDescription: Developing tele-driving technology for autonomous vehicles over a 500km distance between Daejeon and Jeju. Using ultra-low-latency communication via 5G networks, remote drivers can control vehicles in real-time, providing safe intervention when autonomous systems cannot handle situations. This technology can be widely applied in mobility services, logistics, and defense sectors.
teleDriving.impact: Tele-driving technology will significantly improve autonomous vehicle safety, solve driver shortage issues, and create new mobility service models. It will bring innovation especially to long-distance transportation and driving in special environments.

impactStats.text: Enhanced safety protocols and risk management systems
Reduced operational costs through remote vehicle control
Improved response times in emergency situations

teleDriving.videoDescription: Actual operation demonstration video of the Daejeon-Jeju tele-driving system.

publicTransport.title: Daejeon 3-Car Public Transportation
publicTransport.explanation: Innovating Daejeon's public transportation system to maximize traffic efficiency through 3-car connected electric train operation.
publicTransport.detailedDescription: Innovating Daejeon's existing public transportation system by building a 3-car connected electric train operation system. This system greatly improves the efficiency and convenience of public transportation through flexible vehicle deployment based on passenger demand, real-time passenger information, and integration with smart signal systems. It also implements an environmentally friendly transportation system through energy-efficient operation.
publicTransport.impact: The 3-car public transportation system is expected to improve public transportation usage by 40%, reduce waiting time by 50%, and decrease traffic congestion by 30%. It also contributes to environmental protection through reduced carbon emissions.

impactStats.text: Improvement in travel speed for overlapping routes (No. 114, 115)
Reduction in travel time after the introduction of articulated buses.

publicTransport.videoDescription: Actual operation video of Daejeon's 3-car connected electric train system.

airportParking.title: Incheon Airport Parking Improvement
airportParking.explanation: Improving Incheon Airport's parking system with smart technology to maximize user convenience.
airportParking.detailedDescription: Improving Incheon Airport's parking system by integrating IoT sensors, AI-based prediction, and mobile apps into a smart parking solution. Real-time parking space guidance, reservation systems, and automatic payment functions revolutionize the parking experience for users. It also increases parking lot operational efficiency and reduces management costs.
airportParking.impact: The smart parking system will improve parking lot utilization by 60%, reduce parking time by an average of 70%, and greatly improve user satisfaction. It is also expected to reduce parking lot operational costs by 40%.

impactStats.text: Faster parking spot allocation through smart sensor technology
Improved user convenience with real-time availability updates
Reduction in traffic congestion around airport facilities

airportParking.videoDescription: Actual operation demonstration video of Incheon Airport's smart parking system.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about our solutions and services.

item1.question: What types of mobility solutions do you offer?
item1.answer: We provide comprehensive mobility solutions including traffic analysis tools, digital twin technology, autonomous vehicle simulation, multimodal transportation systems, and smart city infrastructure planning.

item2.question: How long does it take to implement your solutions?
item2.answer: Implementation timelines vary depending on project scope and complexity. Typically, our solutions can be deployed within 3-6 months, with ongoing support and optimization services available.

item3.question: Do you provide training and support?
item3.answer: Yes, we offer comprehensive training programs for your team and provide ongoing technical support. Our experts ensure smooth integration and optimal utilization of our mobility solutions.

item1.title: Revolutionary AI-Powered Traffic Management System Launched
item1.author: Dr. Sarah Kim, CTO
item1.content:
Today marks a significant milestone in our journey to transform urban mobility. Our revolutionary AI-powered traffic management system has officially launched, promising to reduce congestion by up to 35% in metropolitan areas.

The Technology Behind the Innovation

Our system leverages advanced machine learning algorithms combined with real-time data processing to predict and prevent traffic bottlenecks before they occur. The platform analyzes patterns from multiple data sources including traffic cameras, vehicle sensors, and historical traffic data.

"This represents a paradigm shift in how we approach urban transportation management," says Dr. Sarah Kim, our Chief Technology Officer.

Key Features

  • Real-time traffic prediction with 94% accuracy
  • Automated signal optimization
  • Integration with existing city infrastructure
  • Mobile app for citizen engagement
The future of transportation is not just about moving vehicles, but about intelligently orchestrating the entire urban mobility ecosystem.

Early pilot programs in three major cities have shown remarkable results, with average commute times reduced by 28% and fuel consumption decreased by 22%.

Looking Forward

This launch is just the beginning. We're already working on the next iteration, which will incorporate autonomous vehicle coordination and predictive maintenance scheduling.
item1.imageCaption1: Traffic flow visualization showing real-time data processing and optimization algorithms
item1.imageCaption2: Control center dashboard displaying citywide traffic management interface

item2.title: Strategic Partnership with Samsung Electronics Announced
item2.author: James Park, CEO
item2.content:
We are thrilled to announce our groundbreaking partnership with Samsung Electronics, combining our mobility intelligence expertise with Samsung's cutting-edge hardware capabilities to revolutionize smart city infrastructure.

Collaboration Scope

This strategic alliance will focus on developing next-generation IoT sensors specifically designed for transportation monitoring and management. Samsung's advanced semiconductor technology will power our AI algorithms, enabling faster processing and more accurate predictions.

The partnership encompasses three main areas:

  • Hardware development for smart traffic sensors
  • Edge computing integration for real-time processing
  • 5G connectivity solutions for seamless data transmission

Market Impact

"By combining dochak's AI expertise with Samsung's hardware innovation, we're creating solutions that will define the future of urban transportation," stated James Park, CEO of dochak.

This partnership represents more than just technological integration – it's about creating an ecosystem that makes cities smarter, cleaner, and more efficient.

The first joint products are expected to enter beta testing by Q2 2025, with commercial availability planned for late 2025.

Global Expansion

This collaboration also opens doors for international expansion, with Samsung's global network providing pathways to markets across Asia, Europe, and North America.
item2.imageCaption1: Samsung-dochak joint development facility showcasing collaborative innovation spaces
item2.imageCaption2: Prototype smart traffic sensors featuring Samsung's advanced chip technology

item3.title: Autonomous Vehicle Testing Reaches Major Safety Milestone
item3.author: Dr. Michael Chen, Head of Autonomous Systems
item3.content:
Our autonomous vehicle testing program has achieved a significant safety milestone, completing over 1 million kilometers of autonomous driving without a single safety incident – a testament to the reliability and sophistication of our self-driving technology.

Testing Achievements

Over the past 18 months, our fleet of autonomous test vehicles has navigated complex urban environments, highway conditions, and challenging weather scenarios. The extensive testing program has validated key capabilities:

  • Object detection and classification with 99.7% accuracy
  • Predictive path planning in dynamic environments
  • Emergency response protocols
  • Human-vehicle interaction systems

Safety-First Approach

"Safety isn't just a priority – it's the foundation upon which all our autonomous systems are built," explains Dr. Michael Chen, Head of Autonomous Systems.

Our comprehensive safety framework includes multiple redundant systems, continuous monitoring, and fail-safe mechanisms that ensure safe operation even in unexpected scenarios.

The goal isn't to replace human drivers, but to augment human capabilities and eliminate the factors that contribute to traffic accidents.

Real-World Applications

This milestone brings us closer to deploying autonomous vehicles in controlled environments such as:

  • Airport shuttle services
  • Last-mile delivery operations
  • Public transportation routes
  • Industrial facility transportation

Commercial applications are expected to begin pilot deployment in Q3 2025.
item3.imageCaption1: Autonomous test vehicle equipped with advanced sensor array navigating urban intersection
item3.imageCaption2: Mission control center monitoring real-time autonomous vehicle fleet operations

item4.title: CES 2025: Showcasing the Future of Mobility Technology
item4.author: Lisa Wong, VP of Marketing
item4.content:
Get ready for an exciting showcase at CES 2025 where dochak will demonstrate our latest innovations in mobility technology, including live demonstrations of our autonomous vehicle coordination system and interactive smart city simulation.

What to Expect

Our CES booth will feature three main demonstration areas:

  • Interactive City Simulator - Experience how our AI manages traffic flow in real-time
  • Autonomous Vehicle Coordination - Watch multiple self-driving vehicles navigate complex scenarios
  • Future Mobility Concepts - Preview technologies in development for 2026 and beyond

Live Demonstrations

Visitors can participate in hands-on demonstrations, controlling virtual traffic scenarios and observing how our AI responds to different challenges and optimization opportunities.

"CES provides the perfect platform to showcase how our technology solves real-world transportation challenges," says Lisa Wong, VP of Marketing.

We're not just showing technology – we're demonstrating the future of how people and goods will move through cities.

Industry Recognition

We're honored to be selected for CES Innovation Awards in the Smart Cities category, recognizing our contributions to urban mobility solutions.

Visit Us at CES

Find us at Booth #12345 in the Smart Cities pavilion. Our team will be available for:

  • Live product demonstrations
  • Technical discussions with our engineering team
  • Partnership opportunity discussions
  • Media interviews and briefings

Schedule a meeting with our team at ces2025@dochak.com

item4.imageCaption2: Interactive smart city simulator allowing visitors to experience traffic management
